intro: Erigeron drenowskii, commonly known as Drenowsky's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It features finely divided, silvery-green leaves and produces small white or pale blue flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
